dont get me wrong i really liked the third installment of saw but i am just wondering how they can make another they killed off both of the main characters and left only a weirdo guy stuck in a room of dead people sure donnie wahlbergs character is most likely still alive but do you really think they would have him become the next jigthink they just need to stop were they did and leave it at that a cliffhanging ending is always good when left alone even though i might check out a psycho officer trying to follow in a genius crazy mans footsteps i just dont think it would make for a good movie and one more thing how is it that died so fast i mean didnt he only have colon cancer when he first found out how did it spread to his brain that fast

yes they have done it again but this time it has become much more of a terrifying ride than a curious one using of course the best of graphics when it comes to blood and gore they didnt cheap us short for anything less than a thriller there are so many things in this movie that made me want to hate the entire series but there is always that slight bit of being pushed off the edge that ties me back into being a completely obsessed fan i think this movie is different from anything i have ever seen in a saw film and im extremely ecstatic for that in this movie i was so happy to see amandas true side for once i dont think the movie before gave her any credit for being so different than any of us has pictured before you probably could not even imagine the clarity and enjoyment of this film unless you have seen it and fell in love with it much like i did i highly recommend this movie to anyone who has not only watched a saw movie previously and loved it but if you hated it as well this movie is complete and utter genius and could not have been made any better

this film kept my eyes glued to the screen and my bum glued to my seat what is there to say about god where do i start for starters i do think you need to have seen the previous saw movies to understand the background of this filmto understand who is who and what is what but that doesnt let the film down one bit i am a huge fan of gore horror movies suspense in movies and just anything that will keep you glued and shocked and believe methis film does just thatmost horror films nowadays tend to keep the gore at a sort of minor levelmeaning there isnt much of it that makes you cringe this film puts gore on a major level i wouldnt say its gorefilled from start to finish but it certainly does have its fair share of extreme blood guts and torturei had heard that here in england several people passed out in the cinema when watching this film and had to be taken to hospitalto give these people the benefit of the doubti can understand why some weak stomachs would be disturbed by more than afew scenes in this movieim not going to let you in on any part of the story as its always best to leave it as a surprise for you but please i would suggest you watch and so it would just help you understand certain parts in this movieif you wanna be hardcorewatch it alone quietly in the dark

i am not a fan of scary movies i know it is not real yet i cannot avoid my unforgiving vivid imagination so obviously i surprised myself when became one of my favorite movies then i t only fitting to see which was not bad but it was no to me seems miles away from s captivating storyline and appropriate violence was gratuitous with its torture scenes and inhumane treatment it is by far the goriest movie in the trilogy there are no new and surprising turns in it is simply 108 minutes of superfluous violence and torture it never stops there is hardly a moment to rest in between each bloody sequenceif you like seeing blood gush flesh rip and bones break then here is your new favorite flick if you are not a fan of torture films run if you are at all squeamish then this is not the movie for you i watched this movie with my current boyfriend who had never before even winced during the other horror films we have watched texas chainsaw the beginning silent hill the omen however the scene that involves an up close and personal brain surgery drilling open the skull and all had him squirmingfive minutes into this movie i was already drained i will admit to having spent the majority of the 108 minutes hiding behind a blanket shielding myself from cruel cruel mind the final scene is less than brilliant but leaves everyone wondering will there be a v you cannot say you have not been warned

i honestly didnt think the saw series would be able to hold ground past the first sequel as amazing and terrific as was even better than the original i could see the inevitable pratfalls that would cause the downward spiral of this series imagine my shock when they took and made it even more spectacular fixed all those plot holes and made the series even more intelligent more gory more creepy and gritty and riveting and made us all wet our appetites for more that makes the saw series an absolute phenomenon among horror films and horror series left behind the premise of a group of people being tortured by the deranged madman and brought back the terror of one person being alone in his game to escape each victim is brought together for a reason and a purpose and heir and student which i thought was a poor addition to the second installment was downright brilliant in the third the story gets more complex with each turn and it has an intelligent well based and terrifying plottobin bell is absolutely brilliant he is now considered the man who has brought forth one of the most terrifying and brilliantly horrific horror movie monsters of the modern dayor john kramer as hes known bell has been a long time character actor been on tv for years and years and usually does play the bad guy because hes just got the ominous flavor to his performance but jigs so versatile i mean jigs more than just depraved and completely sick hes brilliant a genius even he believes he has justification for her murders stating constantly how he hates murderers his soft spoken tone quiet eyes and disturbing voice makes him absolutely phenomenal for this role i admit i wasnt a fan of the addition of a sidekick in but actress shawnee smith certainly changed my mind in this third installment now granted i think the screen writer did something far more phenomenal with her character making her a victim to as much as anyone despite being his heir apparent smith shows a versatility and as deranged as she is there is some pathos felt for her character this time around she comes across as more of the villain than we get a far more in depth look into her character arc and how she got to this point with john in flashbacks and moments between each film up until now angus macfadyen plays latest victim and he will run him through a barrage of tests to teach him forgiveness each test terrifying and disturbing in its own right macfadyen is brilliant as the tortured father who lost his son in a car accident and now faces the opportunity to exact revenge on those he feels are responsible macfadyen makes for a great male lead taking over from cary elwes and donnie wahlberg bahar soomekh plays lynn the brilliant surgeon who is kidnapped by jign order to keep him alive long enough to play one last game soomekh is very good and a strong female lead and shows an equal amount of strength and sincerity as well as appropriate fear and weakness also returning in smaller roles this time around is donnie wahlberg and dina meyer the detectives who have tracked since the original and its sequelwhat else can be said is downright brilliant you cant watch it on its own right to see its true brilliance but rather part of one of the greatest horror trilogys ever made they are laying down a foundation for what could be an incredible series director darren lynn bousman took the helm again after doing the second one and since the two sequels exceeded the original and they seem to be discovering better ways to do things with each one i hope bousman continues to direct what more can they do with the series i say this after every nstallment but i can only hope that they manage to continue down the brilliant path they are on perhaps we will start to see an unraveling of historywe saw tiny moments of it in this film but more could be done so far they have done an incredible job of continuity and bringing everything together is gone i hope noti think hes too smart for that lord knows i wanna play another game incredible film 910

the main difference point of saw from any other thriller is the ethical dilemmas that victims discussable are put and also the cunning setups the setups are so cunning that the ethical dilemma to give life to take life also put the audience into a position what would i do if i were there the saw series in that sense have already been a classic on its own can go iv or v  this s different than the others in that sense who is the victim what can you sacrifice in favor of your work is answered it leaves you into a wander that the stunning and cunning scenario leaves you just there there really remains the sense that what will be in the next much more than any other must warn you that it is more bloody than any other saw as wellthe ethical dilemmas of saw making you silent in the sense that if we were the judge and the rule that people always face eye to eye the missing part of s the repetition of our main characterwhat is missing is the details of the philosophy as a philosopher i can easily say that the main philosophy is worth considering but the deals are visualized these are all ok but the ethical dilemmas can be detailed as philosophy it could be greatoverall if you watch the two please do not miss this 3rd part if not the others do not watch it first watch the other two enjoy your dilemma

i rate the original saw as an 8 as a 7 and this one as a 6 held my interest but i doubt id ever watch it again i think it is the best acted of the three  robert the bruce is definitely a step up but it lacked the cleverness of the first two  the twists are minor and easy to see coming also it promises much more than it delivers suffering you havent seen anything yet the first saw had acting problems and a few too many jump cuts  other than that it was solid the second saw had better acting but the script was somewhat implausible  i mean plan relied on everyone doing exactly as he planned but the final twist was brilliant this one has far too many implausibilities you live with the master game player and never suspect he may be playing you you come across people in deadly peril and you stop to lecture them on how they didnt help when your son was killed i think i would save them first then administer the lecture also it was unclear whether he was allowed to continue regardless of whether he passed the test or not he didnt seem to pass all of them the most annoying part was near the end when they started playing back stuff that happened in prior movies so you could understand the master plan but then they started showing scenes that had just happened three minutes ago we really didnt need those flashbacks thank you and the whole movie is a setup for a sequel presumably the last possible film in the sequence unless they do prequels as well another poster commented that early traps were unfair  i believe this is explained near the end of the movie but the victims in this one do seem a lot more innocent than in the first two films

yet another slasher film is the latest in the saw series about a dying man turned serial killer trying to teach people the meaning of life one man is challenged to save the people who killed his son and the judge who let the killer off on a technicality a brain surgeon is tasked with a brain operation on the master mind knowing that if his heart stops she get blown to bits the ending may be a surprise to most worth watching if you liked the others ratings bad1 average5 one of the best10 acting05 plot06 scenery07 character believability07 continuity08 dialog05 directing08 casting07 special effects07 overall rating07

lately dr lynn denoln bahar soomekh has been going through some marital problems and the anxiety is beginning to affect her work late one night after finishing her shift at the hospital she is kidnapped and taken to an abandoned warehouse shortly after waking up she soon meets the notorious tobin bell he is currently dying slowly as the minutes pass and amanda shawnne smith sidekick tells lynn she has been kidnapped in order to keep him alive alive long enough for someone else thats also been kidnapped named jeff angus macfadyen to complete his very own game while telling lynn this amanda places a collar around lynns neck that is connected to heart rate if his heart rate drops below zero before jeff completes his game the shotgun shells on the collar will all simultaneously go off at the same time amanda then preps lynn as explains its a test of will its a test to see just how willing you are to keep someone alive lynn realizes she has no choice and so the game begins jeff must now navigate through a series of tasks where he is promised his chance to get revenge on the man responsible for his sons death something he has wanted every day for the last three years both lynn and jeff are now each tangled in a horrid game of survival what they dont know is their games are merely stepping stones to the true reason they are involved with latest puzzlefirst off i have to admit i was a little turned off to earlier this week after months of having much anticipation when i heard it was guaranteed that there would be a saw 4 if iii did well opening weekend i feared then and still do slightly that the saw franchise will become what friday the 13th did a series of films where only the first few were considered good once i was sitting in my seat at the theater though and the film began i was vastly interested far more than i imagined i would be this saw has so much story in it than the previous two had and really more than most horror films today do much of it is told generally with various flashbacks even by following the story closely the final twist probably wont be known to you until its unveiling its in the twist that a tiny smidgen of a problem existsits obvious that the twist was meant to shock the audience in a big way maybe it does catch most people by surprise but for me didnt not that it isnt good it just didnt come across the way it should have it gave me a ohokay feeling rather than a holy sht reaction this minor flaw doesnt hinder the films poise at all though it still remains interesting to the very last minutethe only real letdown in the film are some of the traps in all there is a total of six physical ones these devices of torture and terror are what many of people who love the saw series look forward to most out of the six only two were what id say good yes all of them can kill but four of them seemed boring and livid im not sure what happened here although this doesnt destroy the movie in a small way it does take away from it even so the two good traps almost make up for the othersso basically is somewhat better than i expected it borders very closely to the feel of the first which is a definite plus most satisfying though is that it wasnt the least bit dismal never was there a dull moment even with the few shoddy traps now that is done and over with though it only makes me question what 4 have in store for us yes tobin bell was contracted for five films permitting each is considered a success but now that director bousman and writer whannell have decided to step aside and leave the series alone i can only wonder two things will saw become a victim of its own game just how long can the series go on before it suffers the fate jason voorhees did

i fell in love with the series much like many of the horror buffs that have latched on to these movies not particularly interested in spending 900 to see the movie once i just bought it on dvd yesterday and sat in my room for a good watch i was disappointedthe traps are extremely elaborate which the dvd does a good job of showing in the extra features a junkie that cuts herself to me anyway doesnt have the mental capacity to design such a tremendously complex device as the rack or even the angel trapjeffs character is completely uninteresting if they had shown more than just snapshot flashbacks about why he is being tested it might have given the audience more compassion and empathy for his character as it is he just seems like a madman that should really care less about what happens to the victims of the trapsthe relationship between amanda and jigs at best disturbing youd think that amanda was love toy by the way she gets angered at his connection with lynn she seems more like a disgruntled wife than a student of his intelligent mindhaving really enjoyed the first two the third was a huge letdown the ending was predictable and i hope for the sake of the directors and leigh whannell that v can capture the pieces that were missing in this film

i really enjoyed the first two saw movies and looked forward to more of the same in the third installment what i got more of though was just the violence and senseless mutilation the whole thing seemed kind of pointless to me as if they crew were just trying to fit as much violence and gore into it as they couldto me the progression of the storyline in the movie seemed very choppy as well with a lot of flashbacks and side scenes such that it made it hard to concentrate on the storyline i also felt that there were too many unanswered questions remaining for the movie to appear to be the final part of the seriesall in all if youve seen the other two and enjoyed watching the movie for the plot twists and the dramatic irony in the big reveals at the ends this movie does not equal its predecessors if you just want to watch a movie for the violent content this movie is a great way to waste the time

i am a huge fan of the saw movies but i will admit i was so scared to watch this one i personally think this one was harder to watch simply because of the gore the previous saw movies dont have a lot of gore but this one was very painful to watch also it reached the puke factor i about lost it during the pig scene also the victims arent in a whole lot of pain while they try to get out of the trap in the previous films but these victims are in excruciating pain which we find out why towards the end this movie was very clever also like the first 2 i really feel for shawnee smiths character in this movie before she never had a huge speaking role in the movies but in this one she becomes angry and raged and bossy as well i love her sarcasm too and when you watch this movie and find out things you realize how weird and crazy it is that she has been involved in this whole thing longer then anyone expected this movie was very emotional too definitely touches a nerve or two i loved this movie and all the other ones i dont know if a saw 4 is in the making or not but im interested in finding out what it will be like also if you need more info and are confused about this movie listen to the commentary done by the director and leigh whannell it definitely clears things up

what an amazing halloween party movie okay people let me start by saying that i watched and fell in love when i rushed to the theatres eagerly awaiting the 2nd installment i was severely disappointed it seemed like was just a big money grab however  my brother had recently picked up so i decided to pop it in and kill 2 hours what harm could be donethe result this movie satisfied in many ways most people who didnt like it were either upset with the concept of the plot havent seen the previous saw films or were too focused on the depth of realism within the movieyeah its not the worlds most realistic movie its got plenty of flaws but for what it was this movie is absolutely amazingkeep in mind this movie is not for everyone hence the bad reviews but if youre looking for a good time and youve seen both prequels i would highly recommend this movie to any saw fans

this third entry in the saw series amps up the gore over the other two entries and dumbs down the plot a bit seems like this series is having a bit of an internal conflict with itself as it cant seem to decide whether it wants to be a thriller or a ballsout gorefest i like the way that the deaths are getting more graphic but its definitely at the expense of a solid storylinethis one has on his deathbed and he and his apprentice kidnap a surgeon to sustain life until his final guineapig either succeeds or fails in his trapchallenge the competitor is a father whose son was killed by a driver who got off after only six months of jailtime and game is to promise vengeance for the father  if he makes it through a series of obstaclesstarted off great  two rough scenes in the first 15 minutes or so then it starts to slow down a bit the story about jeff the father while providing some decent goregags didnt do much for me storywise i honestly felt no kind of connection to him his plight and really didnt care whether he lived or died i think if it werent for the elaborate death setups i probably wouldnt have cared for this one at all luckily the kills and traps are inventive enough to be entertaining and there are some tense moments as you wait to find out the fate of each person who comes into the picture the ending was a bit uninspired and i found it a bit confusing and implausible of the three  i enjoyed this the original the least two slow not enough payoff the second the best good mix of decent storyline and cool traps and this third one is in the middle i really dug the gore but the storyline just didnt work for me either way id recommend it for gore fans or fans of the series the uncut version of shows that there may be hope for gory hollywoodmade horror afterall7510

of the 3 i enjoyed this one the most it didnt waste any time making you squirm in agony watching it if you are looking for an award winning film dont bother with this one it is what it is a horror film the special effects are top notch and the direction is incredible i loved it the acting is fine and the story line although predictable is entertaining it did leave the ending open for saw part 4 but i hope if they do it they can keep the energy and creativeness that this one had its not really a scary film but more of just a gory bloodfest that i found entertaining if you saw part 2 and were somewhat disappointed as i was check out part 3 it really ramps it up a bit

i am usually not a fan of horror b movies although i have seen the previous saws the first one was said to be breathtaking and i was very disappointed the second was much better but still to be improved so i decided to go for the third hoping nothing more than a popcorn movie it was more than that the third was great and not only great as a saw or horror movie it was clever twisted and you really wonder what the end is gonna be like in the 80s90s there was freddy kruger now there is jingsaw but contrary to freddy kruger the saw franchise has the potential to be remembered as a a movie category because the third is not only good by himself but also justifies and complete the puzzles of the previous ones i am actually surprised to see that has a lower rating than go for it myself i cant surprisingly wait to see the fourth

builds on the foundations of the two previous installments of the series and to that it should take credit it follows almost flawlessly from the story of the previous movie seamlessly integrating the unique themes storyline and motives writers leigh whannell and james wan who cowrote the first two installments create a fresh new atmosphere heavily influenced with the token horror mystery thriller genre that leaves audiences suspended on the edge of their seats although not for the fainthearted and admittedly a little disturbing the visual effects provide an appealing complement to the plot

after watching both and i was definitely anticipating what had to show for and it brought down the whole house this movie was so bloody and so gory that i loved every minute of it the plot is mediocre at best but it really develops a lot better than the plot in the first and second saw the actors in this movie were pretty good and tobin bell does a great job playing jign this movie this movie isnt that scary but expect lots of blood and gore especially if you get the unrated dvd version of it overall its definitely worth renting and possibly buying if you love gory movies is definitely the best of the three

seems like it may suck at first but picks up huge momentum the beginning is stupid wipe out all unawnsered questions kill off two people randomly in near the exact same way and finally start the movie now that im done with the beginning this movie really picks up the traps from here on all great and gruesom as ever amanda is sick and emotional john is on the edge of death and a doctor and a revenge driven father are in the middlei was worried after that saw was the next final destination great idea  reused to hell this isnt the case saw three has its own idea its a prequel and a sequel at the same timeif your a saw fan you need to see this if your not i recommend seeing the films in order but this still wont disappoint

first that everything this movie in the genre of horror this one well besides the message that has is very important for all the persons the revenge does not go nowheresecond the edition unrated is super better than the theatrical version since the best parts they are not observed correctlysuffering you havent seen anything yet is really truethose who like it the movies of horror i recommend to them this one instead of  the texas chainsaw massacre the beginning  with which there is great blood but the history is almost equal to that of 2003if they do not like them the strong at the time scenes see the theatrical versionbye 610

johntobin belland his protg amandashawnee smithare up to their old tricks but in this third filmand my favorite of the seriesthere are some surprises i didnt see coming on trial is jeffangus macfadyen who is blessed with a face and talent that can express all sorts of emotion an emotionally unstable man full of booze wrath  pain consumingly overwhelmed by the loss of his son in a car crash the driver responsible was released shortly after thanks to a hasty trial with pretty much a slap on the wrist that might change a many of us who might have this same type of bitterness and rage if it happened to usor at least i put myself in his shoes the other important character in and amandas new game is a female doctor named lynnbahar soomekh another really great choice for the filmthis film is a success in my eyes because the casting excelswho might be able to prolong his life among other thingsjeff must complete a series of games in less than two hours or face being shut inside the building each game consists of those certain people who played intricate roles in or around his sons demisethe woman who instead of assisting jeff as he held his dying son drove offthe judge who gave the murderer a slap on the wristthe killer himself jeff has their lives in his hands he can forgive or let them perish in and amandas crafted killing apparatuses meanwhile lynn has a metal collar with chambered bullets that is linked to heartrate her duty is to not let him die or else the bullets will fire right into her face also important is amandas rolewhat she does know and doesnt knowhas prepared this whole game for a major purpose to be determinedin the grand scheme of things she will determine the outcome just as much as jeffand not even know it the film does lots of things this goaround delving into how amanda formed her partnership with the loose ends untied from the second film regarding ericdonnie wahlbergwill be finalized and we actually see how prepared the test of the two male characters in the first film these flashbacks regarding amanda are crucial to the development of the film and its climax like the previous two films this one works off of some coincidences provided by a screenplay that needs certain characters to dieor sufferat the right moment before they can be saved or a certain character saved who just happens to be in a specific place to be shot by a shotgun im not convinced anyone could put together such elaborately designed games without something going awry but this like the other two is orchestrated by a screenplay writer with devious intentions for his created characters we see that amanda has created games that give those tested no way to survive which is not method this film is also the most grisly and gruesome of the three showing one unfortunate victimcaught in favorite contraption the twister having his arms legs and head completely twisted around as bones snap out of the skin like broken wood the ultimate goal of jigs choices and forgiveness can jeff make the right choice and forgive those who have caused him so much agony there are many who might be able to pick this apart with a fined tooth comb but i just enjoyed it despite acknowledging that no one is that skillful enough to get away with what the films deathgeniuses do

tobin bell and his attractive assistant amandashawnee smithcontinue horrendous games that cause blood and guts proceeding mangled loss of life police are baffled and at their wits end trying to locate the featured players this time out happen to be a married couple on the verge of divorce gifted dr lynn dentonbahar soomekhfinds herself kidnapped and in the abandoned warehouse where bedridden jigs near death and her game is to save her life by saving the sadistic puppetmaster not only are there other poor souls being viciously tortured to death the docs despondent husband jeffangus macfadyenis also a pawn of the madman racing against faltering heatbeat lynn and jeff have no idea that there is a bigger plan for the both of them grisly violence disturbing sequences of extreme gore with strong language and nudity gives its r rating my favorite sequence is the pigs being pulverized and liquefied other cast members dina meyer leigh whannell donnie wahlberg and barry flatman

no spoilers i really enjoy the saw films has the most beautiful killings i couldnt wait to see and now i have seen it it was very good i dont think it was quite as good as the first saw simply because the first was such a one of a kind for its time and had a mind blowing ending but however it did top the 2nd saw movieas you can expect from the saw movies has a great plot extremely gory scenes some great deaths and i fantastic ending i think is the goriest so far out of the 3conclusion has enough up it sleeve to impress any saw fan its not for the squeamish again brilliant plot gore and ending  810 cant wait for v

film review cast tobin bell shawnee smith and bahar soomekhthe terminally ill psychopath jigs agonizing through his final moments as he lays there on his deathbed he has one final trick up his sleeve his dutiful apprentice amanda played by shawnee smith has already proved herself to the master tactician she acts as his hands eyes and ears in procuring his new test subjectsthe sadistic amanda leaves her victims little chance of survival setting impossible situations for them from which to escape with only one certain outcome each of her distraught subjects writhes in agonyin his final hour upon the stage enlists the help of a nurse to perform a lifesaving operation on him their lives are dependent on one another and upon the success of a third person within the elaborate maze of deathnaturally there is a plot within the mangled plot and it is there that has the last laughthis is a harrowing macabre and sinister tale of unimaginable proportions the moral depravity of the characters is beyond belief especially when one considers that at the films conclusion the audience tends to side with vile conductwith a modest budget of 10 million this film has raked in hundreds of millions worldwide  another huge success for twisted pictures

jigs back and this time hes kidnapped a doctor to keep him alive but all is not as it seems and things soon start hotting up wow what a final piece to the saw trilogy same excellent mix of suspense and gore from the first two films but wow what an ending this is one of the better endings to a film trilogy that i have seen if you have seen the first two films and enjoyed them this will be the cherry on the cake you learn more about the first two films and more great film this installment picks right up from the end of the second film and is none stop fun from the outset killer is back with a bang with even better death scenarios to make you cringe with horror and sometimes with pain as the death scene endings are nicely graphic and the plot grips you with the will he wont he scenario

i had high hopes for saw3 and it does get better towards then endhowever the 1st part was just gore for the sake of having gore and somewhat unrealistic for 1 person to have set up since jigs i presume incapable of doing muchi think it would have been better if they had cut out the 1st part of the film and concentrated on the rest of it especially since knowing how unfair new assistant is you know things are never going to go well for the doctor who has to keep jiggy alivestill there is a nice plot twist at the endworth watching but i wouldnt buy it

probably the most obvious thing a viewer will notice about is that it follows the formula of the first two films thats not always bad of course it worked for last crusade and die hard with a vengeance for instance unfortunately the third film of a trilogy can often end up noticeably inferior to its predecessors this is far more common apparent in films such as jurassic park iii final destination 3 tiii and many others sadly falls into this last categorydont despair however for there are benefits to a formula too namely that you can count on a movie providing an entertaining if not spectacular experienceassuming you enjoyed the first two of course and thats where works if you want gory traps daring escapes and a mysterious master plan thats not revealed until the very end then will deliver also keep in mind its not completely formulaic the relationship between amanda and john has been developing for some time now and continues to do so in this new film which adds a different dynamic the point of view is increasingly focused on john which also gives a unique flavor to this sequelthe problem though preventing me from giving a completely positive review is twofold firstly the character development of the new faces is very lacking secondly for a formula based on plot twists this film is a little too predictable given the pros and cons of the final product id give it a six out of ten in my rating scheme that basically means its worth watching but id wait till its out of the theater
